    ast challenges

    challenges.Rmd
    library(straw)

    ## Loading required package: dplyr
    ## 
## Attaching package: 'dplyr'
    ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     filter, lag
    ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
## 
##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
    ## Loading required package: purrr
    plot_ast <- . %>%
  parse(text = .) %>%
  create_parse_graph(type = "ast") %>%
  tbl_to_cyto() %>%
  cytoscape_dagre(width = "100%")

plot_parse <- . %>%
  parse(text = .) %>%
  create_parse_graph() %>%
  tbl_to_cyto() %>%
  cytoscape_dagre(width = "100%")

    Functions

    expr <- parse(text = "function(a = 1) {2}")
# function node consists of 3 entries
#   1. function keyword
#   2. function args (a pairlist)
#   3. function body (expression | anything)
fun <- expr[[1]]

# the pairlist is the trickiest to handle,
# since in the parse tree each arg is a node
fun[[2]]

    ## $a
## [1] 1
    plot_parse(expr)

    plot_ast(expr)

    g <- create_parse_graph(expr)
g_ast <- create_parse_graph(expr, type = 'ast')

match_expr(g, g_ast, g[2,], g_ast[2,])

    ##   parse_row ast_row
## 1         3       3
## 2         4       4
## 3        10       6
## 4         8       5

    Nesting exceptions

    function formals

    expr <- "function(a, b = 1) 2"

    plot_ast(expr)

    plot_parse(expr)

    = operator

    Need to dig down in AST

    expr2 <- "a + 1= 1 = 2 = 3; 1 + 1"

    plot_ast(expr2)

    plot_parse(expr2)

    expr3 <- "
a = 1 + 2
b = 3
"

    plot_ast(expr3)

    plot_parse(expr3)

    p3 <- parse(text = expr3)
p3[[1]]

    ## a = 1 + 2
    pd <- create_parse_graph(p3)
pd[pd$children[[1]],]

    ##     line1 col1 line2 col2 id parent        token terminal text row_num
## 141     2    1     2    9 14      0 equal_assign    FALSE            2
## 24      3    1     3    5 24      0 equal_assign    FALSE           12
##       children
## 141    4, 5, 6
## 24  14, 15, 17
    expr4 <- "function(a) b = 1"

    plot_ast(expr4)

    plot_parse(expr4)

    # error: "a <- b = 1"
plot_parse("`=` = 2")

    plot_ast("`=` = 2")
